content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\W", "_")
end
```

In this code, `replace` function replaces all non-word characters `\W` (which includes spaces and hyphens) with underscores. The `strip` function removes leading and trailing whitespaces from the string. The `lowercase` function converts the string to lowercase. This function can be used as follows:
```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")) # prints "my_column"
```
